qas.question: In which sector would the government of Samoa like to see deregulation?
The flexibility of what segment could support economic growth in Samoa?
What infrastructure has benefited greatly from capital investment?
What's the name of the team-up between Samoa and Virgin Australia?
Is Samoa helped or hurt by political upheaval in the countries around them?

plausible_answers.text: deregulation of the financial sector, encouragement of investment, and continued fiscal discipline

qas.question: What have neighboring Pacific countries called for?

plausible_answers.text: the flexibility of the labour market

qas.question: What is one strength of Virgin Blue and its operations?

plausible_answers.text: major capital investment in hotel infrastructure, political instability in neighbouring Pacific countries

qas.question: What are two things that have helped the launch of Virgin Samoa?
In what year did the Samoan government call for the financial sector to be deregulated?
What was launched as a joint venture between Pacific countries and capital investment?

context: The Samoan government has called for <b5_0>deregulation of the <a0_0>financial<a0_0/> sector, encouragement of investment, and continued fiscal discipline<b5_0/>.[citation needed] Observers point to <b6_0>the flexibility of <a1_0>the labour market<b6_0/><a1_0/> as a basic strength for future economic advances.[citation needed] The sector has been <a4_0>helped<a4_0/> enormously by <b7_0>major capital investment in <a2_0>hotel infrastructure<a2_0/>, political instability in neighbouring Pacific countries<b7_0/>, and the <b8_0>2005<b8_0/> launch of <a3_0><b9_0>Virgin Samoa<b9_0/><a3_0/> a joint-venture between the government and Virgin Australia (then Virgin Blue).
